I have a set of tests that must always be configured before they can
be exe=
cuted.  I did this using a Suite like this:

@RunWith(DynamicTestSuite.clas=
s)
public class AllTests
{
  @BeforeClass 
  public static void beforeEvery=
thing()
  {
    ...
  }

  @AfterClass 
  public static void afterEverythin=
g()
  {
    ...
  }
}

This works great whenever I run my tests using this =
class.  However,
when one of my tests fails, I go right click on it and run=
 it
individually.  Once I do that, the Eclipse plugin just runs that
class,=
 it completely ignores the fact that it came from a suite. My
individual te=
st has no knowledge of the test setup, so the test fails
because the setup =
was not done properly.  

Is there a way to get the Eclipse plugin to alway=
s run the suite
@BeforeClass method, even if it's running a single test?

I=
'm using Eclipse 3.2, with JUnit 4 installed.
